<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ks1145_1_1"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX A  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The provisions set forth in this Appendix&nbsp;A set forth the provisions of Section&nbsp;5.5A of the Plan which apply to the distribution of amounts deferred
prior to January&nbsp;1, 2005 and credited to Prior Cash Accounts, Prior Dividend Equivalent Cash Accounts, Prior Dividend Equivalent Stock Accounts and Prior Stock Unit Accounts. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.5A</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Distribution of Benefits</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(a)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Time and Manner of
Distribution</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Eligible Director shall be entitled to receive a distribution of the vested portion of his or her Accounts upon his or
her termination from service on the Board of Directors or at such time as may be elected by the Eligible Director at the time of an election under Article&nbsp;IV and set forth in writing on forms
provided by the Company. The benefits payable under this Plan shall be distributed to the Eligible Director (or, in the event of his or her death, the Eligible Director's Beneficiary) in a lump sum
or, if elected by the Eligible Director in writing on forms provided by the Company at least 12&nbsp;months in advance of the date benefits become distributable under subsection (a), in annual
installments for up to 10&nbsp;years. An Eligible Director shall be permitted to make a different election with respect to each annual deferral period as to the time and manner in which his or her
benefits shall be distributed. For each Eligible Director who makes one or more distribution elections pursuant to this Section&nbsp;5.5A(a), each of his or her Accounts shall be divided into two or
more Distribution Subaccounts as necessary to separately account for deferrals which are payable at different times and/or in different manners. For purposes of calculating installments, the Eligible
Director's vested Accounts (and Distribution Subaccounts if applicable) will be valued as of December&nbsp;31 of each year, and divided by the number of remaining installments to determine the
amount of the installment to be paid in the following year. Subsequent installments will be adjusted accordingly for the next calendar year, according to procedures established by the Committee. Such
installment payments shall commence as of the date benefits become distributable under this Section&nbsp;5.5A(a). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(b)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Change in Time or Manner of
Distribution</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding subsection (a): </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
Eligible Director may elect to further defer the commencement of any distribution to be made with respect to benefits payable under this Plan by filing a new written
election with the Committee on a form approved by the Committee; provided, however, that (A)&nbsp;no such new election shall be effective until 12&nbsp;months after such election is filed with the
Committee, (B)&nbsp;no such new election shall be effective with respect to any Account(s) after the distribution of benefits with respect to such
Account(s) shall have commenced, and (C)&nbsp;no more than three new elections with respect to each annual deferral period shall be valid as to any Eligible Director. An election made pursuant to
this Section&nbsp;5.5A(b)(1) shall not affect the manner of distribution (i.e., lump sum versus installments), the terms of which shall be subject to Section&nbsp;5.5A(a) above or
Section&nbsp;5.5A(b)(2) below. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
Eligible Director may change the manner of any distribution election from a lump sum to annual installments (or vice versa) made with respect to amounts credited
under his or her Accounts by filing a written election with the Committee on a form provided by the Committee; provided, however, that no such election shall be effective until 12&nbsp;months after
such election is filed with the Committee, and no such election shall be effective if it is made with respect to any Account(s) after the distribution of benefits with respect to such Account(s) have
commenced. An election made pursuant to this Section&nbsp;5.5A(b)(2) shall not affect the date of the commencement of benefits. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
or before September&nbsp;30, 2000, an Eligible Director may make a one-time, irrevocable election (subject to other express provisions of this Plan), on
forms provided for this purpose, to receive a distribution of his or her accumulated balances under this Plan as of </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>A-1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=17,EFW="2152838",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="5",CHK=802412,FOLIO='A-1',FILE='DISK013:[05BHL5.05BHL1145]KS1145A.;5',USER='GKIBBE',CD='11-MAR-2005;11:15' -->
<A NAME="page_ks1145_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>September&nbsp;30,
2000 on: (A)&nbsp;a date elected by the Eligible Director, but in no event before 2003, or (B)&nbsp;the earlier of a date elected by the Eligible Director, but in no event
before 2003, or the date of his or her termination of service from the Board of Directors. The benefits payable under such an election shall be distributed to the Eligible Director (or in the event of
his or her death, the Eligible Director's Beneficiary) in a lump sum or, if elected by the Eligible Director in writing on forms provided by the Company at least 12&nbsp;months in advance of the
date benefits become distributable under Section&nbsp;5.5A(a) above, in annual installments for up to 10&nbsp;years, as so elected. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(c)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Effect of Change in Control
Event</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding subsections (a)&nbsp;and (b), if a Change in Control Event and a termination of service occurs, the vested
portions of an Eligible Director's Accounts shall be distributed immediately in a lump sum. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(d)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Early Distributions</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Eligible
Director (which for purposes of this Section&nbsp;5.5A(d) includes former Eligible Directors) shall be permitted to elect to withdraw not less than 50% of the vested portion of his or her Accounts,
reduced by the withdrawal penalty described below, prior to the applicable payment date(s) or payment commencement date(s) ("Early Distributions"), subject to the following restrictions: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
election to take an Early Distribution shall be made in writing on a form provided by and filed with the Committee; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
amount of the Early Distribution shall equal 90% of the amount the Eligible Director has elected to withdraw; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
remaining 10% of the amount the Eligible Director has elected to withdraw shall be permanently forfeited, and the Eligible Director or his or her Beneficiary shall
have no rights with respect to such forfeited amounts. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, the Eligible Director's Accounts will continue to vest in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.4 and the Dividend Equivalent Stock Account and/or Dividend
Equivalent Cash Account of such Eligible Director shall continue to be credited with Dividend Equivalents in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.3. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(e)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Distribution for Unforeseeable
Emergencies</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Eligible Director (which for purposes of this Section&nbsp;5.5A(e) includes former Eligible Directors) may request a
distribution for an Unforeseeable Emergency without penalty of an amount not greater than the value of the Eligible Director's vested benefit under this Plan. Such distribution for an Unforeseeable
Emergency shall be subject to approval by the Committee in its sole discretion and may be made only to the extent necessary to satisfy the hardship and only from vested amounts credited to his or her
Accounts. The Committee may treat a distribution as necessary for an Unforeseeable Emergency if it relies on the Eligible Director's written representation, without actual knowledge to the contrary,
that the hardship cannot reasonably be relieved (1)&nbsp;through timely reimbursement or compensation by insurance or otherwise or (2)&nbsp;by liquidation of the Eligible Director's assets, to the
extent the liquidation of such assets would not itself cause severe financial hardship. Amounts distributed pursuant to this Section&nbsp;5.5A(e) shall be distributed first from an Eligible
Director's Cash and Dividend Equivalent Cash Accounts, and, to the extent the balance of the Participant's Cash and Dividend Equivalent Cash Accounts is not sufficient to satisfy the severe financial
hardship, next as a distribution of shares of the Company's Common Stock with a Fair Market Value equal to such deficiency from the vested portion of such Eligible Director's Stock Unit and Dividend
Equivalent Stock Accounts. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(f)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Form of Distribution</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock Units
credited to an Eligible Director's Stock Unit Account and Dividend Equivalent Stock Account shall be distributed in an equivalent whole number of shares of the Company's Common Stock. Fractions shall
be disregarded. Amounts credited to an </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>A-2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=18,EFW="2152838",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="5",CHK=878407,FOLIO='A-2',FILE='DISK013:[05BHL5.05BHL1145]KS1145A.;5',USER='GKIBBE',CD='11-MAR-2005;11:15' -->
<A NAME="page_ks1145_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Eligible
Director's Cash Account and vested in the Eligible Director's Dividend Equivalent Cash Account shall be distributed in cash. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(g)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Small Benefit
Exception</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other provision of this Plan to the contrary, if at the time of any distribution the vested balance
remaining in an Eligible Director's Prior Cash Account or Prior Dividend Equivalent Cash Account is less than $2,000 or, if the number of vested Units credited
to the Eligible Director's Prior Stock Unit Account or Prior Dividend Equivalent Stock Account is less than 100, then such remaining vested balances shall be distributed in a lump sum. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>A-3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.8.2
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>a2152838zex-10_82.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.8.2
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#05BHL1144_6">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1145_exhibit_10.8.2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1145_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.8.2    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NUMBER 3<BR>
TO<BR>
THE MACERICH COMPANY<BR>
EXECUTIVE OFFICER SALARY DEFERRAL PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Macerich Company (the "Company") has established The Macerich Company Executive Officer Salary
Deferral Plan (the "Plan") to provide supplemental retirement income benefits through salary deferrals for certain of its executive officers; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, it is desirable to amend the Plan to provide for the crediting of earnings to the account balances of Dana Anderson and to modify
the effect of a plan termination on the distribution of accounts to comply with Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan is hereby amended as set forth below, effective December&nbsp;15, 2004. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1145_article_i_title_and_definitions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1145_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE I    <BR>    <BR>    TITLE AND DEFINITIONS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;1.2
is amended by changing the definitions of "Company Matching Account" and Deferral Account" to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Company
Matching Account' shall mean the bookkeeping account maintained by the Committee for each Participant that is credited with (a)&nbsp;an amount equal to the Company Matching
Amount (as defined in Section&nbsp;4.2) and (b)&nbsp;to the extent applicable pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.3(b), earnings or losses thereon in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.3(b)(5)." </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Deferral
Account' shall mean the bookkeeping account maintained by the Committee for each Participant that is credited with (a)&nbsp;amounts equal to the portion of the Participant's
Salary that he elects to defer and (b)&nbsp;to the extent applicable pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.3(b), earnings or losses thereon in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.3(b)(5)." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;1.2
is amended by adding the following definitions thereto: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Earnings
Rate' shall mean, for each Fund, an amount equal to the net rate of gain or loss on the assets of such Fund determined for each business day." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Fund'
or "Funds' shall mean one or more of the investment funds designated in Section&nbsp;4.3(b)(2)." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1145_article_iv_participant_accounts"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1145_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IV    <BR>    <BR>    PARTICIPANT ACCOUNTS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;4.3
of Article&nbsp;IV is amended by changing its title to "Interest or Earnings" and by amending it in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"4.3&#151;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Interest or Earnings</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Interest or Earnings</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.No interest or earnings shall be credited to a Participant's Accounts. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investment Elections for Certain Participants</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
Section&nbsp;4.3(a), effective December&nbsp;15, 2004, Dana K. Anderson shall be eligible to designate, on a form provided by the Committee or
otherwise in accordance with procedures established by the Committee, the Fund or Funds in which the amounts credited to his Deferral Account and Company Matching Account will be deemed to be invested
for purposes of determining the amount of earnings or losses to be credited to his Accounts. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2152838",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="6",CHK=88368,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK013:[05BHL5.05BHL1145]KO1145A.;6',USER='GKIBBE',CD='11-MAR-2005;11:15' -->
<A NAME="page_ko1145_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
of December&nbsp;15, 2004, the Funds shall be the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life Guaranteed Interest Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life Money Market Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life Select Bond Fund </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life High Yield Bond Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life Balanced Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life Index 500 Stock Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mason
Street Advisors Large Cap Core Stock Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life Growth Stock Fund </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Franklin
Templeton International Equity Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life Aggressive Growth Stock Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwestern
Mutual Life Index 400 Stock Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Russell
Real Estate Securities Fund </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;T.
Rowe Price Small Cap Value Fund </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
making the designation pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.3(b), Dana Anderson must specify, in whole numbers, the percentage of his Deferral Account and Company
Matching Account that shall be deemed to be invested in one or more of the Funds. Effective as of the end of the day on which the Committee receives Dana Anderson's election, he may change the
designation made under this Section&nbsp;4.3(b) by filing an election in accordance with procedures established by the Committee. If Dana Anderson fails to elect a Fund under this
Section&nbsp;4.3(b), he shall be deemed to have elected the Northwestern Mutual Life Money Market Fund. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Earnings Rate of each Fund shall be used to determine the amount of earnings or losses to be credited to Dana Anderson's Accounts under this Article&nbsp;IV. The
Company reserves the right to increase or decrease the number of the Funds listed in Section&nbsp;4.3(b)(2), as well as the right to designate other investment funds as the Funds (instead of those
currently listed in Section&nbsp;4.3(b)(2)) for purposes of this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(5)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dana
Anderson's Deferral Account and Company Matching Account shall be divided into separate subaccounts ("investment fund subaccounts"), each of which corresponds to an
investment fund elected by him pursuant this Section&nbsp;4.3(b). As of the end of each business day, each investment fund subaccount of Dana Anderson's Deferral Account and Company Matching Account
shall be credited with earnings or losses in an amount equal to that determined by multiplying the balance of such investment fund subaccount as of the end of the prior business day by the Earnings
Rate for the corresponding Fund for the day of crediting. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(6)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
Dana Anderson's ability to designate the Funds in which his Accounts shall be deemed to be invested, the Company shall have no obligation to invest any
funds in accordance with his election. Dana Anderson's Accounts shall merely be bookkeeping entries on the Company's books, and he shall not obtain any interest in any Funds." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<A NAME="page_ko1145_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1145_article_vii_administration"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1145_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VII    <BR>    <BR>    ADMINISTRATION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;7.3
is amended by deleting the period at the end of paragraph&nbsp;(7) and adding "; and" in its place and by adding a new paragraph&nbsp;8 to the end thereof to
read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"(8)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
compute the Earnings Rate for each Fund in accordance with the terms of the Plan." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1145_article_viii_miscellaneous"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1145_5"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VIII    <BR>    <BR>    MISCELLANEOUS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;8.4
is amended by adding the following sentence at the end thereof: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"Notwithstanding
the foregoing, in the event that this Plan is terminated in full or as to Dana Anderson, the amounts credited to Dana Anderson's Deferral Account and Company Matching Account shall be
distributed to him in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.1." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has caused its duly authorized officers to execute this amendment this 3<SUP>rd</SUP> day of February,
2005. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>MACERICH

<P><FONT SIZE=2>MACERICH
CM VILLAGE GP CORP., a Delaware corporation </FONT></P>

EQ GP CORP., a Delaware corporation </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>MACERICH
EQ LIMITED PARTNERSHIP, a California limited partnership </FONT></P>

FARGO ASSOCIATES, a California general partnership </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>MACERICH

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> <A NAME="km1144_consent_of_independent___km102335"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_km1144_1"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>To
the Board of Directors and Stockholders of<BR>
The Macerich Company<BR>
Santa Monica, California </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
consent to the incorporation by reference in the Registration Statements on Form&nbsp;S-3 File Nos.&nbsp;333-21157, 333-80129, 333-88718,
333-107063, 333-109733, 333-121630 and Form&nbsp;S-8 of our reports dated March&nbsp;25, 2005 relating to the consolidated financial statements and
consolidated financial statement schedules of The Macerich Company and of Pacific Premier Retail Trust, and management's report on the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting
appearing in and incorporated by reference in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of The Macerich Company for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Deloitte&nbsp;&amp;
Touche, LLP<BR>
Los Angeles, California<BR>
March&nbsp;25, 2005 </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><I>The Macerich Company&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>161</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;23.2  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> <A NAME="ko1144_consent_of_independent___ko102337"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1144_1"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
hereby consent to the incorporation by reference in the Registration Statements on Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-21157), Form&nbsp;S-3 (File
No.&nbsp;333-80129), Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-88718), Form&nbsp;S-3, (File No.&nbsp;333-107063),
Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-109733), Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-121630) and Form&nbsp;S-8 of The Macerich Company of
our reports dated March&nbsp;11, 2004, except for Note&nbsp;2, Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets as to which the date is March&nbsp;11, 2005 and March&nbsp;11,
2004, relating to the consolidated financial statements and financial statement schedules of The Macerich Company and of Pacific Premier Retail Trust, which appear in this
Form&nbsp;10-K. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>PricewaterhouseCoopers
LLP<BR>
Los Angeles, California<BR>
March&nbsp;25, 2005 </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>162</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Macerich Company</I></FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 23.3
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#05BHL1144_10">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;23.3  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> <A NAME="kq1144_consent_of_independent___kq102339"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kq1144_1"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Partners<BR>
SDG Macerich Properties, L.P.<BR>
and<BR>
The Macerich Company </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
consent to the incorporation by reference in the registration statements of The Macerich Company on Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-21157), Form&nbsp;S-3
(File No.&nbsp;333-80129), Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-88718), Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-107063),
Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-109733), Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-121630) and Form&nbsp;S-8 of our report dated
March&nbsp;4, 2005, relating to the balance sheets of SDG Macerich Properties, L.P. as of December&nbsp;31, 2004 and 2003, and the related statements of operations, cash flows, and partners'
equity for each of the years in the three- year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, and the related financial statement schedule, which report appears in the December&nbsp;31, 2004 Annual Report
on Form&nbsp;10-K of The Macerich Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>KPMG
LLP<BR>
Indianapolis, Indiana<BR>
March&nbsp;25, 2005 </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><I>The Macerich Company&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>163</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2152838",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="10",CHK=827611,FOLIO='163',FILE='DISK012:[05BHL4.05BHL1144]KQ1144A.;11',USER='GKIBBE',CD='24-MAR-2005;18:15' -->

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>11
<FILENAME>a2152838zex-31_1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#05BHL1144_11">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ks1144_1_164"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;31.1  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> <A NAME="ks1144_section_302_certification"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ks1144_1"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION 302 CERTIFICATION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Arthur M. Coppola, certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004 of The Macerich Company;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrants other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and
15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and
the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="73%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Date: March 25, 2005</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>ARTHUR M. COPPOLA</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> [Signature]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>President and Chief Executive Officer</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> [Title]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>164</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Macerich Company</I></FONT></P>

<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;31.2  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> <A NAME="ku1144_section_302_certification,_continued_"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ku1144_1"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION 302 CERTIFICATION, Continued:    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Thomas E. O'Hern certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004 of The Macerich Company;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrants other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and
15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and
the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>

<TYPE>EX-32.1
<SEQUENCE>13
<FILENAME>a2152838zex-32_1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 32.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#05BHL1144_13">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_kw1144_1_166"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;32.1  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> <A NAME="kw1144_the_macerich_company_(the_comp__the02973"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kw1144_1"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE MACERICH COMPANY (The Company)<BR>  WRITTEN STATEMENT<BR>  PURSUANT TO<BR>  18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
undersigned, Arthur M. Coppola and Thomas E. O'Hern, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, respectively, of The Macerich Company (the "Company"), pursuant to 18 U.S.C.
&sect;1350, hereby certify that, to the best of their knowlege: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004 of the Company (the "Report") fully complies with the requirements of
Section&nbsp;13(a) and 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

Officer</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
